Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2007 10:42PM Sherrie_Lee wrote: Ladies I have an update regarding my friend Don that has colon cancer.  He is going back to work on October 15th.  Our church is having a Chicken and Homemade Noodle Dinner on October 20th and he is planing to come and help cook. He is not sure when chemo will start but it will be for about 5 months depending on how well he is doing. They found a spot on the liver and they scraped it off and cut another piece off.  They removed 15 inches from the small and 18 inches from the large.  He does not have to wear a bag so that is a good sign. Thanks so very much for all those wonderful prayers. SMILE and KEEP the FAITH Sherrie Lee
Posts.Title: Prayer of a fellow human being Sherrie_Lee Sherrie_Lee

Posts.Content: Sherrie_Lee wrote: Ladies, I need prayer for a friend of mine with cancer of the colon.  Don had surgery on Wednesday September 26th.  He has a tumor in the colon, has spots on his liver and it has gone to his stomach.  They are going to give him chemo.  I am not sure as to what kind or for how long. He is a man of faith and knows that God has some wonderful plans for him.  He informed us all that this cancer has given him a chance to witness to us all about God's awesome love for all of us. Sure wish when I was going though breast cancer I could have had an out look on life as Don has. Oh I now this is a breast cancer board but in my eyes cancer is cancer no matter where it appears. KEEP the FAITH and SMILE Sherrie Lee Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Prayer of a fellow human being Sherrie_Lee Sherrie_Lee

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2007 03:53AM Sherrie_Lee wrote: Thank you so very much Sue. Some folks from my church went to see him over the weekend and he is doing as well as he can. SMILE and KEEP the FAITH Sherrie Lee
